intro: Arabis lyrata var. occidentalis, commonly known as the Western rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine regions. The plant features basal leaves that are broadly ovate with a wavy margin, and it produces clusters of small, white, four-petaled flowers. It is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. This species is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
